iana.template_text:
(last updated 2010-07-20)

Name : hao wang

Email : howard.wang&huawei.com

MIME media type name : Application

MIME subtype name : Vendor Tree - vnd.oma.cab-feature-handler+xml

Required parameters : none

Optional parameters :
none

Encoding considerations : 8bit
This media type may require encoding on transports not capable of
handling 8 bit text.

Security considerations :
This content type carries the information associated with CAB User's
feature request & response status for CAB Service features: Contact
Share & Scheduled interaction with non-CAB address book system. The
XML document will be protected by authorization policies enforced by
the XCAP Server where the XML document will be stored, which controls
access to the document content. The content itself does not include
confidential fields, and further it does not provide either privacy or
integrity protection. There does not contain active or executable content.

Interoperability considerations :
This content type provides the information for CAB User's feature
request & response status for CAB Service features: Contact Share &
Scheduled interaction with non-CAB address book system, as defined by
OMA CAB

Published specification :
The OMA CAB Specification is published at
http://www.openmobilealliance.org/.

Applications which use this media :
OMA-specified applications that make use of the OMA CAB service enabler.

Additional information :

1. Magic number(s) : none
2. File extension(s) : none
3. Macintosh file type code : none
4. Object Identifiers: none



Person to contact for further information :

1. Name : OMA Converged Address Book (CAB) Sub-working Group 2. Email :
technical-comments&mail.openmobilealliance.org

Intended usage : Common


Author/Change controller : The OMA Converged Address Book specification
is a work item of the OMA Communications Work Group. The Open Mobile
Alliance has change control over this specification with mailing list
address technical-comments&mail.openmobilealliance.org.

(file created 2010-07-20)
